snippet: A man granted asylum in the United States aims to help his wife and his 2-year-old daughter, who could be subject to female genital cutting.
abstract: Catholic Charities Archdiocese of New York, supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, draws $400 to buy insulated winter boots, winter coat and professional work attire for Buya Jammeh, who is campaigning for human rights in his native Gambia and hoping to bring his wife and child to United States.
lead_paragraph: A man granted asylum in the United States aims to help his wife and his 2-year-old daughter, who could be subject to female genital cutting.

headline.main: Journalist Threatened in Gambia Wants to Rescue His Daughter
